text: thanks <@U0ZR63HLK> - just saw it

<@U0ZR63HLK> - in my process of removing membersrvc from fabric master repo, I also removed most of the code in core/crypto as well (it was just too intertwined to try to modify).   Check out <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/2273>
I tried to leave placeholders in parts of the code which used to call the various crypto clients so that we can integrate the new crypto / idp code
Hi <@U0PB67X4K>, why are removing the code before having the idp working? Just to understand
I would have thought to have first the idp working and then the unnecessary crypto part removed.
Of course, I agree that ad then v1 will not have those files anyway
I think it's easier this way
I left the plug points - you'll see a bunch of TODO comments
plus I could not easily remove membersrvc without removing the crypto stuff
this way we can add things one at a time -  load identity for the peer, use identity to sign, etc
I believe that's the way to go having followed the opposite approach of incrementally replacing in other areas and I don't think it works well
okay, got it. Thanks :slightly_smiling_face:
I gave my +1. I cannot give +2
:slightly_smiling_face:
btw, I know you are busy with BCCSP… so that’s why thought it was great when Gari volunteered… hope you were ok with that ...
sure, thanks :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U0ULK2JPP> or anyone else, would appreciate some additional review so that we can get this in before it needs to be rebased again <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/2075/>
(Also <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/2153/> )
I changed my +1's to +2's so just need some other review(s)
<@U0ZR63HLK> - for PKCS11 / HSM, is the plan to test against SoftHSM by default?
just wondering if we need to start thinking about how to add it into our CI, etc
Actually, I have been talking about this with Tamas. I would love to have it in. I will have probably more info already tomorrow. I will tell you asap
no worries - you know I get random thoughts so just decided I'll ping'em as they come up
